results.content: Heavily outdated, Django has moved on. The course works if you install Django from 4 years ago.
results.content_html: Heavily outdated, Django has moved on. The course works if you install Django from 4 years ago.

results.content: Needs an update. Based on Django 1.8. Things have changed since then. Not always helpful to connect the dots, concepts are pasted onto the screen with few explanations to how they relate to Django's inner workings.
results.content_html: Needs an update. Based on Django 1.8. Things have changed since then. Not always helpful to connect the dots, concepts are pasted onto the screen with few explanations to how they relate to Django's inner workings.

results.content:
A very comprehensive course, covers lot of content and most importantly teaches skills to develop real world projects. 

A great way to start learning django.
results.content_html:
A very comprehensive course, covers lot of content and most importantly teaches skills to develop real world projects.

A great way to start learning django.

results.content: It's a really nice Django walk-through. It covers a lot of Django features and provides examples using them. I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to delve into Django.
results.content_html: It's a really nice Django walk-through. It covers a lot of Django features and provides examples using them. I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to delve into Django.

results.content:
Its a shame, because this could have been a great tutorial.  Tons of content to cover - a voice that speaks clearly, and polished looking presentations.  

They'll give instructions, but the video shows they're encountered error and just just don't address it.  The voiceover acts as if there was no issue at all.  

They also go over line limits and don't wrap, so when the code goes past the width of his text editor you can't see it.  Not exactly fun as a  learner - and the solution of downloading source code to compare is inefficient (Two text editor windows + video + preview screen open, then hopping back and forth)

They'll copy and paste an entire section of code, but only want to to enter some of it.  You go back to the copy/pasta later.

There are just too many cheaper/similarly priced options right on udemy that blow this out the park.  Jose Portilla, Rob Percival & Justin Mitchell's- to make a few.
results.content_html:

They'll give instructions, but the video shows they're encountered error and just just don't address it. The voiceover acts as if there was no issue at all.

They also go over line limits and don't wrap, so when the code goes past the width of his text editor you can't see it. Not exactly fun as a learner - and the solution of downloading source code to compare is inefficient (Two text editor windows + video + preview screen open, then hopping back and forth)

They'll copy and paste an entire section of code, but only want to to enter some of it. You go back to the copy/pasta later.

There are just too many cheaper/similarly priced options right on udemy that blow this out the park. Jose Portilla, Rob Percival & Justin Mitchell's- to make a few.

results.content: Very boring, very repetitive, jumpy, doesn't explain all things given.
results.content_html: Very boring, very repetitive, jumpy, doesn't explain all things given.

results.content: Very in depth course. I have been developing django applications for a year and found the lectures to be quick-passed and concise. Add to that a very professional presentation and you have a very useful course for someone that has some experience with django.
results.content_html: Very in depth course. I have been developing django applications for a year and found the lectures to be quick-passed and concise. Add to that a very professional presentation and you have a very useful course for someone that has some experience with django.

results.content: The content is diverse and organized, but there's a huge of lack explanation stemming from what I assume is the speaker's lack of familiarity with the written content.
results.content_html: The content is diverse and organized, but there's a huge of lack explanation stemming from what I assume is the speaker's lack of familiarity with the written content.

results.content: The course is outdated, and none of the code works. You will spend a solid few hours just trying to fix the issues his code comes with. Very frustrating, don't recommend.
results.content_html: The course is outdated, and none of the code works. You will spend a solid few hours just trying to fix the issues his code comes with. Very frustrating, don't recommend.

results.content:
Feels too robotic and the voice over by professional has been done. I guess he only mentions what has been told to him. Also this course is more about implementation and very very less about concepts. You wont find any constructive Q&A with each video.You can only take benefit out of this course if you have completed few tutorials from Youtube and familier with basics. 
But if you want things as advanced learning, this is a good place for you. 
What can be improved immediately: Please provide files in the resource section. Currently the author has given one downloadable file for the entire video series. Its very difficult to understand those unless you have finished the entire lecture.
